Welcome to bayev’s documentation!¶

Contents:

Documentation¶

bayev.perrakis.estimate_density(x, method='histogram', **kwargs)[source]¶

Estimate probability density based on a sample. Return value of density at sample points.

Parameters:
  • x (array_like) – sample
  • method (str) – method used for the estimation. ‘histogram’ estimates the density based on a normalised histogram of nbins bins; ‘kde’ uses a 1D non-parametric gaussian kernel; ‘normal approximates the distribution by a normal distribution

Additional parameters

Parameters:nbins (int) – number of bins used in “histogram method”.
Returns:density estimation at the sample points.
bayev.perrakis.compute_perrakis_estimate(marginal_samples, loglike, prior, likeargs=(), priorargs=(), densityestimation='histogram', **kwargs)[source]¶

Computes the Perrakis estimate of the bayesian evidence.

The estimation is based on n marginal posterior samples (indexed by s, with s = 0, ..., n-1).

Parameters:
  • marginal_samples (array) – samples from the parameter marginal posterior distribution. Dimensions are (n x k), where k is the number of parameters.
  • loglike (callable) – function to compute ln(likelihood) on the marginal samples.
  • prior (callable) – function to compute ln(prior density) on the marginal samples.
  • likeargs (tuple) – extra arguments passed to the likelihood function.
  • priorargs (tuple) – extra arguments passed to the prior function.
  • densityestimation (str) – the method used to estimate the marginal posterior density of each model parameter (“normal”, “kde”, or “histogram”).
Parameters:kwargs – additional arguments passed to estimate_density function. :param nbins: number of bins used in “histogram method”. :type nbins: int
Returns:

Perrakis et al. (2014; arXiv:1311.0674)
